basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ My name is Tomislav Pajic. I am a Blockchain Developer who has always been excited about Blockchain technology, but recently I decided to learn Ethereum development and take part in this revolution by building. I learn more about the technology every day, and constantly progress with my programming skills. In the beginning, I coded basic Solidity smart contracts, then explored the Ethereum stack further. I encountered Truffle, Ganache, Infura, Hardhat, Web3.js, Ethers.js, GoEth, OpenZeppelin contracts, etc. There are multiple full stack apps I built that are showcased in the Featured Project section below. Now I feel ready to take the final step, which is to find a company where my skill can truly be challenged, and I can showcase my problem solving while building an exciting project in an ambitious company.

projects.title: NFT Marketplace
projects.description: Full project inspired by NFT Marketplaces with the basic functionality like creating an NFT, listing it for sale, buying other NFTs, viewing your holdings and transactions. Built on top of the starter code and guide provided by Dapp University. Technologies used: Solidity 0.8 for writing the smart contract, JavaScript for the front-end and testing, Ethers.js for interacting with Blockchain, Hardhat as the development framework, IPFS for the metadata storage and finally React Routers for navigation components.

projects.title: NFT Music Player
projects.description: Interesting project inspired by Spotify with an added NFT twist where a user can buy each song as an ERC721 token. Built on top of the starter code and guide provided by Dapp University. Used Solidity 0.8 for writing the smart contract, JavaScript for the front-end and testing, Ethers.js for interacting with Blockchain, Hardhat as the development framework, IPFS for the metadata storage and finally React Routers for navigation components.

projects.title: Vending Machine
projects.description: This is a very basic smart contract that showcases how we would simulate the vending machine functionality using the Solidity programming language. There is no UI implemented as this is just a basic concept showcase, nothing too advanced. You can run this code by copy-pasting it to Remix IDE and deploying it to Testnet/VM.

projects.title: Forkify
projects.description: Vanilla JavaScript app for searching a large recipe database, also supports bookmarking favorite recipes, adjusting serving sizes and adding your own recipes. Created as part of The Complete JavaScript Course 2022 by Jonas Schmedtmann. Showcases very advanced JavaScript functions  and logic knowledge, JavaScript classes, asynchronous JavaScript, MVC architecture, etc.

projects.title: Mapty
projects.description: Vanilla JavaScript app for logging your workouts on a real map of your current location pulled by your geolocation. Supports two different workouts - running and cycling. Stores your workouts in the local storage, and keeps them whenever you refresh the website. Created as part of The Complete JavaScript Course 2022 by Jonas Schmedtmann. Showcases OOP, geolocation APIs, external libraries, local storage usage, etc.

projects.title: Bankist
projects.description: Vanilla JavaScript which acts as a demo version of basic NetBanking functionality. You can send money between accounts, request a loan, close your account, view all of your previous transactions, etc. Created as part of The Complete JavaScript Course 2022 by Jonas Schmedtmann. It showcases advanced functions knowledge, logic, DOM manipulation and working with different array methods.

experience.title: Front-End Developer
experience.about: Building custom Shopify and Wordpress websites mostly for e-commerce clients. Starting with nothing but the client's vision on paper, then turning it into a finished product using existing plugins and even creating apps of my own if the client's needs can not be met with existing solutions.

experience.title: CNC Programmer
experience.about: Programming high-performance, fully optimized code which is used for controlling CNC Milling machines in the process of manufacturing high-precision ( +/- 0.05mm ) parts for various industries. Mostly worked in the Heidenhain interface, also familiar with CAD-CAM technologies. Very responsible job, I was included in the whole technological process from analyzing technical documentation and planning the whole production until the finished product left for packing and delivery. Some of my work was delivered to companies such as Bosch, Leica, Syntegon, etc.
